Seven points as York lacrosse win both games

Both Lacrosse sides tasted victory over Hull in the opening day of Varsity (Thumbnail credit Image: Lucy Dixon)

Women's tennis share the points

The women's tennis firsts earned two points each for their respective universities after a competitive fixture in some unkind weather

Dancesport earn 11 points for York with fine showing

Four categories of Dancesport took place this morning as York took on Hull in the first ever White Rose Varsity (Thumbnail credit Image: Philippa Grafton)

Varsity 2011 Fixture List

The updated and comprehensive fixture list for both days of the inaugural White Rose Varsity (Thumbnail credit Image: Peter Iveson)

Varsity day one: As it happened

The Nouse Sport team bring you all the action from the first day of the inaugural White Rose Varsity

York left to rue missed chances as Leeds City College march on

The men's football fourths was one of the few games to survive Wednesday's downpour, but it wasn't all good news as York went down 5-2 to Leeds City College (Thumbnail credit Liam Condron, in action here for Langwith in last summer's College Cup, was drafted in but couldn't prevent a 5-2 loss for the men's fourths. Image: Jason Lozier)

Bowling improvement essential if England are to beat the hosts

Henry Cowen previews England's match against India on Sunday morning and argues that, unless their bowling performance increases drastically, it could be a long day (Thumbnail credit Virender Sehwag lies in wait for an England attack that needs to improve on its performance against the Netherlands. Image: deepfriedbrain via Flickr Creative Commons)

Men's fencers reach semi-final of cup with win over Aberdeen

The men's fencers sealed passage to the semi-final of the BUCS Cup with a narrow 120-114 victory over Aberdeen (Thumbnail credit The men's fencers, seen here in action against Newcastle in January. Image: Peter Iveson)

Whitewash for women's badminton against under-par Durham

The women's badminton firsts enjoyed another extremely successful day at the office, hammering Durham University thirds 8-0 (Thumbnail credit Image: Philippa Grafton)

York Centurions just miss out on third win of the season

The York Centurions travelled to Northumbria Mustangs last weekend, buoyed by their successive victories, but came out on the wrong side of a 28-20 scoreline. (Thumbnail credit The York Centurions, pictured here in the game in which they tasted success for the first time, are enjoying a good season. Image: Justyn Hardcastle)

Men's hockey break losing streak with deserved win

Goals from Adam Tyrell and Henry Meller led York's men's hockey firsts to a 2-0 win over the University of Sheffield seconds on Wednesday (Thumbnail credit Club President Mark Inman in action for the men's firsts on Wednesday. Image: Katie Davis)

Halifax win battle of College Hockey over rivals James

Halifax and James went head-to-head in a winner-takes-all battle of College Hockey this morning, with Catherine Johnson's Halifax winning 2-0 (Thumbnail credit Barnaby Spink, scorer of Halifax's second goal. Image: Philippa Grafton)

Nouse Sport Podcast - York Sport Presidential edition

By James Bithell

The Nouse Sport team are joined by York Sport Presidential candidates Sam Asfahani and Ben McGladdery for a special edition of the Nouse Sport Podcast (Thumbnail credit The two York Sport Presidential candidates, pictured here discussing their love of Nouse Sports - obviously. Image: Peter Iveson)

Cricket World Cup: a preview

Richard Smith previews the 2011 Cricket World Cup, tipping Andrew Strauss' England for a group stage exit in the process (Thumbnail credit Hide that excitement, it's the Cricket World Cup. Image: najeebkhan2009 via Flickr Creative Commons)

Women's badminton cup run continues

The women's badminton side carried on from their success against York St. John in the league by beating them by the same score, 5-3, in the cup (Thumbnail credit Image: Philippa Grafton)

First loss since December sends men's badminton out of the cup

A first defeat since December saw the men's badminton firsts exit the cup at the hands of Dundee (Thumbnail credit Image: Philippa Grafton)

Men's football seconds suffer at the hands of Sunderland

The men's football seconds suffered a 4-1 defeat at the hands of Sunderland seconds on Wednesday (Thumbnail credit Image: Justyn Hardcastle)

Superb Stewart helps women's footballers to six of the best

A hat-trick from striker Gabby Stewart allowed York to put six past the University of Leeds seconds in a comfortable victory (Thumbnail credit Image: Peter Iveson)

Wilson goal secures win over Sunderland

A penalty-flick from James Wilson led York's men's seconds to a 1-0 win over the University of Sunderland firsts as they push for promotion (Thumbnail credit Image: Justyn Hardcastle)

Great performance from netballers end Newcastle's unbeaten streak

York's netballers overcame league-leaders Newcastle University 33-25 this afternoon (Thumbnail credit Image: Peter Iveson)

Anderson at the double as York come back to earn draw

Two goals each from Sheffield's Clare Reid and York's Sophie Anderson meant York seconds and Sheffield fourths played out a competitive 2-2 draw (Thumbnail credit Image: Peter Iveson)

Monday Night Lights: Ambrozejczyk on American Sport

David Ambrozejczyk is back once again to deliver another instalment of his hugely popular American sports blog (Thumbnail credit Kevin Garnett. Image: Keith Allison via Flickr Creative Commons)

Women's firsts undone by rejuvinated Newcastle

York's women's firsts travelled further up north last week to take on Newcastle seconds, traditionally a comfortable win, but found themselves on the wrong end of a 12-0 scoreline (Thumbnail credit The women's rugby firsts, pictured here against York St. John, suffered their first loss of the season at the hands of Newcastle seconds. Image: Courtesy of University of York Women's Rugby Club)

One goal proves all the difference as Derwent edge out Alcuin

A goal from Dan Atherton secured a tight 1-0 win for Derwent over Alcuin this morning (Thumbnail credit Image: Justyn Hardcastle)

Beadle's brace secures Halifax win over Goodricke

Goodricke's great form came to an abrupt end at the hands of a Jack Beadle-inspired Halifax as they lost 4-1 (Thumbnail credit Image: Justyn Hardcastle)

Late flourish secures heavy James win over Wentworth

Postgrads Wentworth were on the receiving end of another heavy loss this morning, losing 6-1 to James (Thumbnail credit Image: Justyn Hardcastle)

Vanbrugh beat the elements and Langwith with convincing win

Vanbrugh battled against the elements to defeat Langwith 3-0 this morning (Thumbnail credit Image: Justyn Hardcastle)

Should we shut the window for good?

In the final blog in our series on the January transfer window, Luke Gardener asks whether we really need it (Thumbnail credit Harry Redknapp is a big mover in the transfer window normally, but this year spoke out against it. Image: niallkennedy via Flickr Creative Commons)

How much is a footballer worth?

Graham Lilley questions our attitude to footballers and the amount of money paid for their services (Thumbnail credit Can Torres really be worth PS50m? Image: comcinco via Flickr Creative Commons)

Nouse Sport Podcast

By James Bithell

Another edition of the Nouse Sport Podcast is here. This week we discuss BUCS Wednesday's happenings as well as England's footballers winning in Denmark, England's rugby players winning in Wales and Darren Gough being approached by the Tories (Thumbnail credit The disappointment on the women's hockey team's faces is clear for all to see as they learn that after listening to this week's podcast, they'll have to wait another week for the next edition. Image: Peter Iveson)
